website_summaries.verdict: The unique design might turn some away, but Radius has proven this fork can handle tough work.
pros: Though the shaft is shorter than average, the ergonomic design still allows it to work well for those over 6 feet tall
Can easily break up compact, heavy clay soil
cons: Under extreme pressure, the tines can bend

customer_reviews.title: This company will not honor their warranty
customer_reviews.text: They say they offer a lifetime replacement warranty. Don't believe it. This cheaply made turning fork broke the first day I used it. had to finish my project using a regular pitch fork. I contacted the company 3 times and never got a response. I sent these pictures to them. Suggest looking for another product from another company. Don't waste your time with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis B.

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good tool, the times are sharp and they break up heavy soil. But after using it a few times there are a couple of things that Are a bit disappointing. 1. It is not so wide so my foot slips off sometime when I’m driving it down. 2. One of the tines became bent. This is more of an aesthetic issue, and it still functions just fine. But being stainless steel I expected it to be more durable. Next time I will spend a bit more and get something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in every way ... but needs to be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea behind this fork. A ring handle means you can use two hands for leverage when you need to and in fact that is the case. Also the fork is surprisingly light. It’s also the perfect length. Even the price isn’t bad. I had to remove a star because the firm’s times aren’t as sturdy as you would hope. I’ve used it maybe 5 times and already two of the tines have bent slightly out of position. It hasn’t affected the overall functionality yet but it’s something to monitor. It needs to be stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Yousif A. Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Replaces favorite fork
customer_reviews.text: Like my old fork, wh gave up the ghost (my husband had reconstructed the handhold once, but the second time there was nothing left to reconstruct it from), it appears to be extremely durable. (The old one was 20 and had had hard use). The tines slide into even packed ground easily and release the soil without trouble, wh is a biggie. Also, a good height.
customer_reviews.author: Writer

customer_reviews.title: Best digging fork
customer_reviews.text: A good strong digging fork. Well made steel construction so it will last a very long time. Not too heavy but does have some weight to it. Sharp tines with cover for safety. A nice addition for the gardener that needs to dig a bit without shoveling. It is a bit pricey but well made, not likely to break. The handle makes it really easy to use without straining your hands or arms. The handle has a good gripping surface so you have full control over your tools. All in all, a good buy and the best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Urania of Magistry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 203 Pro spading fork
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this Radius spading fork 203 Pro model as it has not bent or broken as others have over time, the ergo handle is innovative and works well to help reduce hand and wrist fatigue. The fork has been used quite a bit and none of the tines have bent. We tend to be on the extreme side of gardening and have used a lot of forks and spades over time this is very good in my opinion to date. If my opinion changes I will update this.
customer_reviews.author: Old Boy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE GOOD TOOL very useful
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been used a good deal in less than 90 days and it broke on Sunday while digging in the garden. I have some hard clay ground and (I am a large 260# man) It showed no sign failure and it snapped. I email the company and in less than 24 hours have already got a replacement in the mail to me. THIS IS FANTASTIC customer service and I would by from them without a thought. She even apologized for the tool breaking!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Steurrys

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tool in the garden shed!
customer_reviews.text: I like short handled tools as I find them easier to use. This fork is very sharp and very tough. Having said this, my husband bent a tine on a tree root, but was able to hammer it back straight, no problem, and the tool is still good as new. I love this fork. I am very pleased with the quality of this tool and would buy more from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gauthier Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid construction that won't bend easily
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality of this digger. I use this every weekend on my daylily farm and have a lot of experience with these types of diggers. The solid construction of where the forks merge into the handle really make this worth the price. I've owned several that the forks are a separate piece that has been joined to the handle & shaft and that is where they always fail. Highly recommend this brand. If you have ever had a digger like this bend or warp because you were digging something heavy you will be very happy you bought this one. I ended up buying a second one so that my helpers on the daylily farm also have one.
customer_reviews.author: Swirly

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this digging fork to use in a market garden. Do not reccomend!!! Not only did the digging fork break as quick as a plastic fork at a family BBQ, but they now claim that their "life time warranty" does not apply if your property is not under certain amount of acres, regardless of how you used digging fork. Company even spent the time to research how many acres my farm was and proceeded to assume that digging fork was used at commercial scale without asking if that were the case. Terrible customer service and terrible product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very well-designed and sturdy. Definitely worth having for any serious gardener.
customer_reviews.text: Well-designed, easy to use (as much as any garden fork can be). I wasn't sure about the circle handle, but I found that it is much easier to use than my old conventional forks. Good design and looks sturdy. I purchased it toward the end of last season and put it through heavy work on a new garden plot, working compost into heavy clay soil. I only wish I was as sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cres

customer_reviews.title: It gets heavy use and abuse and looks just like it did the day it arrived
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought in August 2013. It's now October 2016 and we haven't broken it yet! Strong, yet lightweight. It gets heavy use and abuse and looks just like it did the day it arrived. It could use a little reinforcement in the area holding the shaft to the fork, but otherwise it has exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Great for breaking into harder ground!
customer_reviews.text: The round handle is especially nice so you can hold both sides of the handle instead of the top! Strong & sturdy. This tool is AMAZING if you have hard dirt. The fork will go right into the ground where a shovel takes much more pressure. I am so sorry that I did not have this Border Fork last year when I was ‘plowing’ in this yard for the first time. Every new spot I need to dig now I am loosening with this great tool. Would like to have gotten the blue color but it was not offered here at Amazon. Not a fan of GREEN garden tools since they are too easy to loose in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic and effective
customer_reviews.text: I love this digging fork. It's light and easy to handle, but it gets the job done like a heavier fork would. I've used it to dig four new beds and it does a great job of loosening up the soil with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl J.Top Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: #203 fork broke; replaced by manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I love using this fork, adore the handle, but it broke as many others have written at the handle/fork junction. I emailed and thought i received no answer, but apparently the answering email didn't reach my inbox. A phone call cleared things up, and i have a new, replacement fork on the way for $7.95 shipping, which is pretty reasonable. I probably wouldn't buy a cast metal garden tool again, as this and another Radius tool (hand weeder) both snapped on me, but they stood behind my request for a replacement fork, so i'm satisfied. One star off for the hassle of replacing a 'lifetime' tool.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Throw away your shovel. If you really want to dig up the ground, this little beauty slides into the earth with ease. Want a great design.
customer_reviews.author: Artist@Work

customer_reviews.title: Love this Fork!
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous medical problems now that I have aged and because of these problems there are a lot of things I can no longer do. I am also short, 5'2" and have a hard time finding things to accommodate my height--this fork is just the right length for me to be able to handle comfortably and light enough that it does not put stress on my bad back. I use it to turn my compost with and it works beautifully for this purpose. I wished I had bought this fork years ago when I first started composting and might have more compost by now. I would definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila LSTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Products
customer_reviews.text: This company produces products that are superior and this Digging Fork is anther in their line. I will get many many years of work out of this fork, and the shovel that I have of theirs also. They tines on this fork are slimmer than most and the weight of the tool, its shape, and balance allows for much easier use - for any age. I am an 'older' woman (I hate that saying) and am smaller too but with this it is so much easier to maneuver and use. Recommended for anyone who wants to make their gardening lives much easier. I own a seed company and there is LOTS to use this and the shovel on.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne E. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Ours broke
customer_reviews.text: This came highly recommended particularly for its strength. But within 10 times of using it one tine snapped right off - my husband is 140 pounds and 70 years old so I would have expected it to do better. Hopefully this was a one off bad tool since we bought 4 different tools by this maker
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was surprized the circle top worked as well as it did. When stabbing the earth, the circle allowed you to have two hands on it in a sturdy way. The product was also very sturdy itself, and I'm glad we purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Reed

customer_reviews.title: Tough as they come
customer_reviews.text: I am truly impressed with the strength of this gardening fork. I have put it through some very tough soil and it held up like a champ! I will be looking for other gardening tools from this company. Glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Farr

customer_reviews.title: Best fork I have ever had, bar none !
customer_reviews.text: For one thing the solid steel construction means never again a loose handle! This fork will outlast me, I'm sure of it. But the crowning feature is that circular ring! It really does make work far easier, (and less painful for my arthritic hands) ! (BTW this reminds me of the joystick of the WW2 Spitfire fighter. The Brits knew something that escaped other military aircraft designers. Which was then forgotten for fifty years.)
customer_reviews.author: Machinery's Handbook

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: My son convinced me to buy this after raving about it's ability to break up lumps by inserting the tines twice and twisting at right angles. Though it is somewhat easier for him since he has a lot more strength the fork has great features even for the weaker ladies. It is very sturdy with comfortable 2 hand grip. Has sharp stainless steel tongs that don't rust. Breaks up lumps and allows you to dig up heavy plants with less damage to the plant and no bending in the fork. Superior to most other garden forks I have used.
customer_reviews.author: LTB

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I am really hard on my tools. I tried it out on dry soil, worked great. I tried it out on we soil, worked great. I must say I have great soil, none of that clay crap. So, if you have great soil this is your tool! Also, the area I tried this out was filled with over 2 ft weeds and it was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fork
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the great reviews. Stainless tools are easier to use I think as soil does not stick so readily. Anyway, I was using this to remove some tough bushes which my gardener seemed reluctant to tackle and I was putting so much pressure on the handle I was worried it would break. I have had this happen before but the Radius fork handled it like a champ. The round handle is easier to use than a traditional D or T type and is very comfortable to use. Definitely one of the best forks around and is great value
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this garden fork... I double dug my entire backyard by hand with this thing - it is solid! It tore old tree roots and 2x4s out of the ground without issue, and was very handy for removing a bunch of old brick and pavers that had sunk below the ground level. My wife says it's too heavy for her, but otherwise I highly recommend this product. I thought the handle was a gimmick, and really only bought it for the solid neck, but that handle really helps after a few hours of digging up old sod and crabgrass to turn into garden beds!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Konar

customer_reviews.title: You’ll be very sad when it breaks
customer_reviews.text: It feels good. I like the weight of it, and the size and shape of the tines. But both times I’ve used it one of the tines has bent badly and I’ve needed to stop working to beat it back into shape on my anvil. I think the metal or the heat treatment was bad on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Glyph250

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite gardening tools now
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite gardening tools now. I like it so much that I own two of them so that my kids can help me in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Satsuki

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Sturdy and easy to use. Turns hard dirt as easy as you please. So worth the money. Makes garden life easy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Trumbo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. Use instead of large bulky broad forks in small garden.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: I have seen similar tools for 4 times the price that don't seem to be any better. They are 2 to 3 times as wide, but that doesn't justify 4 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan - planesaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice digging fork, but broke with just a couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this digging fork, but the prongs bent just within the two times I used it and my soil isn't even that compacted. Update: after using this for the 4th time 3 of the tines snapped. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Pitchfork delivers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pitchfork. The stainless steel forks are solid, solid, solid and non-rusting. I use this for turning my compost and it is great. I also use it for loosening my garden and it is great. I love the rounded handle which gives me many more degrees of freedom than a traditional fork. I've been very happy with all of my Radius Garden equipment and this is no exception. I've not noticed the green color fading as I've read in other reviews but if it does, who cares?... it's a pitchfork.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: First, it's a great looking tool. I prefer the old school steel and hardwood, but this is kinda modern and fun. The handle is not as awkward to use as I thought it would be, and I have enough room to push down with my foot (I'm 5ft 5in). So far, it's been sitting outside in the rain for the past month, as has not rusted. I haven't dug out huge roots with it yet, but I don't think they're going to bend. I will update it I manage to damage them with my rampant gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, appears sturdy. It is a little heavier than I expected, and should be durable. I haven't rated durability because we have had it less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: hanksgirl

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had this last year...
customer_reviews.text: ...when I was planting. This tool is a godsend with my clay soil. I use it as a "broad fork" since I only have small areas to work and not a large garden. I HIGHLY recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michele in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: The best there is!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous gardening tool! As mentioned in other reviews, being able to put both hands in the handle for heavy work is extremely helpful! Makes turning over my garden (almost) a pleasure!
customer_reviews.author: KKann

customer_reviews.title: Very good fork
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Perhaps a little heavy for my wife but does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Redemption
customer_reviews.text: I would have given the Radius Digging Fork 5 stars except that it did break on me after 2 yrs. Click on the comments under J. Benway's review to get details of how Radius' customer service department handled my replacement request so that I had a new fork w/i half a day. I will add that except for the breakage, I loved using this digging fork. The circular handle is a major plus for me. The big box stores just don't have quality spading forks. A favorite locally-owned nursery recently started carrying the full Radius line of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Zelda Gilroy

customer_reviews.title: This is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try this even though it cost 1.5 times a regular digging fork in retail stores. But the ergonomic handle more than pays for the price difference. This is very easy to use. I dug by entire back lawn ( ~900 sq ft) in a day with this. This is a good workout too. I also found another use for this fork - I have English Ivy over my entire back yard and was trying to up root them - I use this fork to go under the ivy and uproot them. Very handy indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Ziddhique

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be an excellent tool for a variety of purpses including mixing compost into garden beds, moving mulch, and even transplanting trees. I have now owned it for about 1 1/2 years and have beat it soundly. The handle and tines are very strong. The unique shape of the handle allows for a greater number of uses than a typical digging fork including the ability to cultivate with a twisting motion. Well worth the price and has saved me from having to 'fork' over big bucks for a proper broadfork
customer_reviews.author: GW Hayduke

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy forks.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, it was not the one that I wanted. I wanted the smaller width one. But I gave it as a gift anyway. I already had two Radius Garden forks and they get a lot of use. I prefer the smaller one because it is more focused and I can exert more pressure. I like the ergonomic handle.
customer_reviews.author: spacengin

customer_reviews.title: Solidly made, and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 pitchforks fail me this spring, so I was hoping this one was going to better made, and indeed it is! Solid thick metal tines and a double bolted junction to the strong shaft gives me a lot of confidence that this fork with outlive me! The funky circular handle is different, but comfortable so far and the neon green makes it very easy to spot in the toolshed!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best pitch fork I've had so far
customer_reviews.text: Best pitch fork I've had so far. I use them for the compost bins and I've gone through 3 in the last 8 years. So far this one is holding up as well, or better than the metal one I had that made it the longest. The wooden ones tend to rot, the plastic ones tend to get brittle and crack and get hot in the sun, etc. This one is easy on my wrists and back too. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heltsley

customer_reviews.title: I'm Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Fork tines are 1" longer than an Ames and shape is square rather than rectangle. A bit heavier too reflecting sturdier construction design. Ergonomic handle is intuitive. Feels like it has better leverage and inflicts less damage to plant roots. And rust resistant to boot!
customer_reviews.author: GGFlieger

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last but nice to look at
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dad to pitch his compost pile. He's 66, and not careless with tools. This tool got regular but light use for two years before the handle cracked in half like a toothpick. The ergonomics and style were nice, but the tool is not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: note: width is not the specified 7.5" !!
customer_reviews.text: Even the manufacturer's website at [...] says that this border fork #204 is 7.5" wide. It is not. It is 5.5" wide. The manufacturer has a model #203, which is supposed to be 7.5" also. Can't say how wide #203 REALLY is, but the #204 is DEFINITELY not 7.5". However, I will keep it, because it's stainless steel and the handle is not supposed to break. I've had ones with wooden handles, which rot in a year or two. For the price, this one will outlast the ones with wooden handles and is less expensive, to boot. We'll see how it performs. I intend to use it to dig up clumps of daylilies.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use with turning compost - not too large or small, although the cost was higher than I wanted to pay this fork will last a very long time which will make up the cost over time. Turning compost every 2 weeks was my goal to keep the process going, and this fork does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Baranowski

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: The first time this tool was used, I was digging out some unruly ground cover in my moist NW garden soil. The fork hit a buried rock and one of the tines snapped off. I would not expect this from a well-rated garden digging tool that carries a "lifetime guarantee". Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful digging fork
customer_reviews.text: This is such a sturdy and useful tool for digging up soil and adding amendments (peat moss, compost) to enrich the soil. I love the size of the tool and the soft round handle. I look forward to gardening with all the Radius Garden tools, especially this one! I purchased all the garden tools, including the small hand-held ones. I'm a huge fan!
customer_reviews.author: On The Farm

customer_reviews.title: My 12 year old 75 pound daighter was using it to break up some monkey grass roots and the fork broke off of the handle very easi
customer_reviews.text: This tools is said to be indistructable, well it is NOT. My 12 year old 75 pound daighter was using it to break up some monkey grass roots and the fork broke off of the handle very easily. I have not gotten a reply from customer service regarding a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Victory

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only have it for a few weeks but I am impressed by the quality. I like the comfort of the round handle. I bet if used correctly it will last a long time. Just like any other tool if not used correctly you could break it.
customer_reviews.author: Skipoffools

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pitch fork. I have a bad back and this is easy to use in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: lisaftweedy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the garden.
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my husband and he loves it. Easy to use and handle.
customer_reviews.author: Duvall Lily

customer_reviews.title: Weed master
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a wood chip pile but just used it to lift sod and weeds in a flower bed, save a ton of time and made it so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Scott E Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Works easier than a regular pitchfork!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to dig the compost and to dig to plant. I have arthritis in my knees so it has always been difficult to use a regular pitchfork...however, I do not have the aches after using this!! That's a big win for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I only use Radius garden tools for spade and fork.
customer_reviews.author: Munchkin

customer_reviews.title: Strength of fork
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy duty fork.The fork portions appears to be solid like it may have come from a single piece. I doubt it will ever fail.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D Camp

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I can go through garden forks... I dig a lot. This fork is the bomb. Make sure you store it in safe area. I leaned it against the fence and my dog somehow impaled herself on it in a freak accident. I think she knocked it over chasing a squirrel... I don't know. She needed stitches. Just saying... but it is a fantastic tool.
customer_reviews.author: Beans

customer_reviews.title: Best Gardening Fork
customer_reviews.text: One of the ergonomic garden tools made by Radius. The handle is what makes this the best garden fork you can buy. It is extremely durable and provides a significantly improved grip. Once you have used one of these Radius tools, you will not switch back. They are on the expensive side but do provide value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't want to be without it!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is one I use in the garden a lot! It's great for digging up daylilies and other plants with little damage to the roots. I also use it to work the soil and get rid of weeds. This fork and the hori hori are my favorite garden tools.
customer_reviews.author: annie m

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems to be a very sturdy tool for our garden and landscaping. I like using it for multiple tasks and I am very hard on tools, sometimes expecting them to go far beyond what they were made for.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Ohio

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I am getting a whole set now ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional grade hand tool. I love it! I am getting a whole set now due to the quality of this fork. IF I ever bend the tines or break the handle, it will be replaced, but I would have to abuse and misuse this to do any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K. Nesbitt

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the Radius Garden 203 PRO for a year, used it to dig all my garden beds, and it is the best I've ever used. It is a strong, solid fork that I believe will last for years, unlike the multitude of forks I've owned in the past. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Photojo

customer_reviews.title: Steel digging fork
customer_reviews.text: This digging fork is very well made and strong. When I bought it I was looking for a narrow fork pitch fork and did not realize how thick the tines would be on this tool. I like it enough to keep it and search again for a regular pitch fork.
customer_reviews.author: yarder

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool, great for planting perennials, aerating, and getting weeds out by the root. I did bend one of the tines trying to pry out a rock, but that's not what it is for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality garden fork
customer_reviews.text: I've had this fork for 2 1/2 years and been using it in the garden regularly that whole time. It's a very tough fork, managing heavy-duty double digging projects with no problem. It's a little on the heavy side, but I don't mind because I think that's why it's lasting so long and performing so well.
customer_reviews.author: Saskia Mills

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy, well made digging fork.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy, well made fork. I am a middle aged female and was able to successfully dig up a vegetable garden approximately 10 feet by 5 feet in an afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: It was not the same quality
customer_reviews.text: I have to order one thinking that what's going to be the same one and no I did not like it this time it's way different
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Casillas

customer_reviews.title: Great turning fork
customer_reviews.text: I got to use a friends when I did some work at our church garden last fall, and I knew I wanted to get one. I used the new fork to break up an turn the area where I am locating a raised bed. Great design and ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBfromNC

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a 5' tall woman the Fork has worked ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 5' tall woman the Fork has worked very well. The primary task has been to extract bulbs so they can separated and the Fork's ergo design has worked well to allow two handed push & pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Dibbles of Kenmore

customer_reviews.title: and seems like it will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: Easier to use, haven't bent it yet, and seems like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best one so far.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews for other digging forks I ordered this one and have not been disappointed with the results. The fork and tines are made of stainless steel in one piece, which makes it more sturdy than the welded ones. I have very rocky soil here in Va. and it dug the ground very well. The handle is soft and has a good grip. I have read reviews complaining of breaking tines on the fork but this is a gardening and not a construction tool and should last a lifetime with proper use.
